abstract: Kenneth D. Brody, who turned 70 this year, will remain a principal and an adviser at the firm, as well as a “significant investor,” he said in a letter.
snippet: Kenneth D. Brody, who turned 70 this year, will remain a principal and an adviser at the firm, as well as a “significant investor,” he said in a letter.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Brody, a co-founder of the hedge fund Taconic Capital Advisors, plans to retire from his full-time role by the end of the year, he told his investors on Tuesday.
